title: Analysis of piecewise function graph part - b

content.description: A continuous function f is defined on the closed interval <math> <mrow> <mo> − </mo> <mn> 4 </mn> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mi> x </mi> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mn> 6 </mn> </mrow> </math> . The graph of f consists of a line segment and a curve that is tangent to the x -axis at x =3, as shown in the figure above. On the interval 0< x <6, the function f is twice differentiable, with f ''( x )>0.
content.question: For how many values of a , <math> <mrow> <mo> − </mo> <mn> 4 </mn> <mo> ≤ </mo> <mi> a </mi> <mo> < </mo> <mn> 6 </mn> </mrow> </math> , is the average rate of change of f on the interval [a, 6] equal to 0? Give a reason for your answer.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
